description:
The NeonNumber component is the equivalent of an <input type="number" /> with -/+ spin buttons. This is intended for simple (unformatted) number inputs where there is a step, min and/or max. For all other number inputs it is recommended to use NeonInput directly and customize it to suit your needs.

NeonNumber supports all of the properties found on an HTML <input>.

props.name: value
props.description: The value of the number input. Either a valid number or null.

props.name: min
props.description: The minimum value the input can accept.

props.name: max
props.description: The maximum value the input can accept.

props.name: step
props.description: The step value for the spin buttons.

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether or not the component is disabled.

props.name: inputmode
props.description: The HTML inputmode of the component. Either 'numeric' or 'decimal'.

props.name: incrementLabel
props.description: ARIA label for the increment spinner button.

props.name: decrementLabel
props.description: ARIA label for the decrement spinner button.
